page.title: 13The Gondola, Coniston Water
page.content: The{Gondola}is a magnificent restored {steam yacht}which runs a regular passenger service on Coniston Water. The original vessel was built in 1859, but had fallen into disrepair, lying half-submerged at the south end of the lake. The{National Trust}decided to restore her, and with the aid of a public appeal, and grants from the Countryside Commission and the Tourist Board, Vickers Shipbuilding (Barrow) rebuilt the hull and superstructure. In spring 1980 the completed hull was{relaunched}on Coniston. The ceremony was performed by Mrs. Howell, great grand-daughter of Captain Hammel, Master of Gondola from 1863 to 1913. The Gondola's {inaugural voyage}took place in June 1980, with the Duke of Devonshire as passenger of honour.
